title: Question 8
prompt: A frog’s tongue is attached at the front of its mouth instead of the back, allowing the frog’s long, sticky tongue to reach out farther from its mouth. This adaptation allows the frog to:
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: A frog’s tongue is attached to the front of its mouth instead of the back, and this allows its tongue to reach out farther from its mouth. The frog’s tongue is long and sticky because the frog uses its tongue to catch insects. Since its tongue can reach farther, the frog can catch insects that are farther away.
